metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3191 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The compile_branch function in pcre_compile.c in PCRE 8.x before 8.39 and pcre2_compile.c in PCRE2 before 10.22 mishandles patterns containing an (*ACCEPT) substring in conjunction with nested parentheses, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer overflow) via a crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror, aka ZDI-CAN-3542.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre2-16-0 - 10.21-1
libpcre2-32-0 - 10.21-1
libpcre2-8-0 - 10.21-1
libpcre2-posix0 - 10.21-1
pcre2-utils - 10.21-1
No subscription required

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcre3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.38-3
pcregrep - 2:8.38-3
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Wei Lei Peng Haoxiang and Liu Yang

notes.Note: mdeslaur> apply-upstream-revision-1631-closes-8159 in unstable doesn't reproduce on precise

criterions.comment: pcre2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.21-1').
pcre3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.38-3').
